Sequence Information.Family: Derived from the HIV glycoprotein, gp41
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.23019445]Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC<10 μg/ml, MBC=20-30 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli (MIC=10-30 μg/ml, MBC=40-50 μg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.23019445]EC50=195 μg/mL against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Binding Target: gp41w-FKA binds at the interfacial region of a phospholipid bilayer.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: gp41w-FKA peptide to adopt a helical conformation in the cosolvent mixture of chloroform, methanol and water. The peptide formed a very well defined
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Design of a novel tryptophan-rich membrane-active antimicrobial peptide from the membrane-proximal region of the HIV glycoprotein, gp41.
Literature.Reference: Beilstein J Org Chem. 2012;81172-84. Epub 2012 Jul 24.
Literature.Author: Haney EF, Nguyen LT, Schibli DJ, Vogel HJ.
